00018

00026 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00027 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00028 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00030 
00031 int generate_population(int **x, int n, int N, int *num_vals=NULL)
00032 {
00033   int i,j;
00034 
00035   // general all variables uniformly randomly
00036   // (if the numbers of values is not supplied, assumes binary)
00037 
00038   if (num_vals==NULL)
00039     for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00040       for (j=0; j<N; j++)
00041         x[j][i]=(drand()<0.5)? 0:1;
00042   else
00043     for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00044       for (j=0; j<N; j++)
00045         x[j][i]=intRand(num_vals[i]);
00046 
00047   // return the number of generated individuals
00048   
00049   return N;
00050 }
00051 
00052 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00054 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00056 
00057 int generate_BB_population(int **x, int n, int N, int k)
00058 {
00059   int i,j,l;
00060 
00061   // generate a population full of 000..0 and 111..1 building blocks
00062   // (used for testing the model building procedure, unnecessary for
00063   // practical applications)
00064 
00065   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00066     for (j=0; j<n;)
00067       {
00068         int val=(drand()<0.5)? 0:1;
00069         
00070         for (l=0; l<k; l++)
00071           x[i][j++]=val;
00072     };
00073 
00074   // return the number of generated individuals
00075 
00076   return N;
00077 }

00079 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00080 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00081 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00083 
00084 int **allocate_population(int n, int N)
00085 {
00086   int i;
00087   int **x;
00088 
00089   // allocate a population as a 2-dimensional int-array
00090 
00091   x=new int*[N];
00092   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00093     x[i]=new int[n];
00094 
00095   // return the allocated array
00096 
00097   return x;
00098 }

00100 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00101 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00102 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00104 
00105 void free_population(int **x, int n, int N)
00106 {
00107   int i;
00108 
00109   // free memory used by the population
00110 
00111   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00112     delete[] x[i];
00113 
00114   delete[] x;
00115 }

00117 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00118 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00119 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00121 
00122 int evaluate_population(int **x, double *f, int n, int N, long &num_evals)
00123 {
00124   // evaluate all individuals, one by one
00125 
00126   for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00127     f[i]=objective_function(x[i],n);
00128 
00129   // increase the number of evaluations
00130 
00131   num_evals+=N;
00132 
00133   // return the number of evaluated individuals
00134 
00135   return N;
00136 }

00138 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00139 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00140 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00142 
00143 int tournament_selection(int **y, int **x, double *f, int n, int N, int k)
00144 {
00145   int i,j;
00146 
00147   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00148     {
00149       // select a winner of k tournaments (with replacement)
00150 
00151       int winner=intRand(N);
00152       for (j=1; j<k; j++)
00153         {
00154           int l=intRand(N);
00155           if (f[l]>f[winner])
00156             winner=l;
00157         };
00158 
00159       // the winner takes the next spot in the selected population
00160 
00161       for (int ii=0; ii<n; ii++)
00162         y[i][ii]=x[winner][ii];
00163     };
00164 
00165   // return the number of selected individuals
00166 
00167   return N;
00168 }

00174 
00175 void print_population(FILE *f, int **x, int n, int N)
00176 {
00177   int i,j;
00178   
00179   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00180     {
00181       for (j=0; j<n; j++)
00182         fprintf(f,"%u",x[i][j]);
00183       fprintf(f,"   %f\n",objective_function(x[i],n));
00184     };
00185 }

00187 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00188 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00189 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00191 
00192 int restricted_tournament_replacement(int **x, int **y, int n, int N, double *fx, double *fy)
00193 {
00194   int i,j;
00195 
00196   // use default value for window size
00197 
00198   int windowSize=(n<N/20)? n:(N/20);
00199 
00200   // for every individual, do the same
00201 
00202   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00203     {
00204       // select a random subset from the original population (window) and 
00205       // find the most similar guy to the new individual in this window
00206       // (string Hamming distance)
00207 
00208       int pick=intRand(N);
00209       int dist=individual_distance(x[i],y[pick],n);
00210 
00211       for (j=1; j<windowSize; j++)
00212         {
00213           int pick2=intRand(N);
00214           int dist2=individual_distance(x[i],y[pick2],n);
00215 
00216           if (dist2<dist)
00217             {
00218               pick=pick2;
00219               dist=dist2;
00220             }
00221         }
00222 
00223       // if the most similar guy from the window is better than the new guy,
00224       // the new guy replaces it
00225 
00226       if (fx[i]<fy[pick])
00227         {
00228           memcpy(x[i],y[pick],sizeof(x[i][0])*n);
00229           fx[i]=fy[pick];
00230         }
00231     }
00232 
00233   // return the number of processed new individuals
00234 
00235   return N;
00236 }
00237 
00238 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00239 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00240 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00242 
00243 int full_replacement(int **x, int **y, int n, int N, double *fx, double *fy)
00244 {
00245   int i;
00246 
00247   // just replace entire old population with the new guys
00248 
00249   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00250     {
00251       memcpy(x[i],y[i],sizeof(x[i][0])*n);
00252       fx[i]=fy[i];
00253     }
00254 
00255   // return the number of processed new individuals
00256 
00257   return N;
00258 }
00259 
00260 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00261 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00262 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00264 
00265 int individual_distance(int *x, int *y, int n)
00266 {
00267   int i;
00268   int d=0;
00269 
00270   for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00271     if (x[i]!=y[i])
00272       d++;
00273 
00274   return d;
00275 }

00281 
00282 int one_run(Parameters *params, PopulationStatistics *stats)
00283 {
00284   int N=params->population_size;
00285   int n=params->problem_size;
00286   int max_generations=params->max_generations;
00287 
00288   int **current_population;
00289   int **selected_population;
00290   int **sampled_population;
00291 
00292   double *current_f;
00293   double *sampled_f;
00294 
00295   int *num_vals = new int[n];
00296 
00297   // allocate populations and necessary fitness arrays
00298 
00299   current_population = allocate_population(n,N);
00300   selected_population = allocate_population(n,N);
00301   sampled_population = allocate_population(n,N);
00302   
00303   current_f = new double[N];
00304   sampled_f = new double[N];
00305 
00306   // initialize the replacement method
00307 
00308   ReplacementMethod *replacement;
00309   if (params->replacement==0)
00310     replacement=restricted_tournament_replacement;
00311   else
00312     if (params->replacement==1)
00313       replacement=full_replacement;
00314     else
00315       {
00316         printf("ERROR: Unknown replacement method (%u)\n",params->replacement);
00317         exit(-2);
00318       };
00319 
00320   // initialize the number of values
00321 
00322   set_num_vals(num_vals,n);
00323 
00324   // generate initial population
00325 
00326   generate_population(current_population,n,N,num_vals);
00327 
00328   // evaluate initial population
00329 
00330   evaluate_population(current_population,current_f,n,N,stats->num_evals);
00331 
00332   // initialize some main-loop variables
00333 
00334   int done=0;
00335   int t=0;
00336 
00337   // init the statistics and print the initial status information
00338 
00339   init_population_statistics(stats);
00340   compute_population_statistics(current_population,current_f,n,N,num_vals,stats);
00341   
00342   if (params->quiet_mode==0)
00343     print_status(t,stats);
00344   else
00345     params->verbose_mode=0;
00346 
00347   // main loop
00348 
00349   while (!done)
00350     {
00351       // increment generation counter
00352 
00353       t++;
00354 
00355       // selection
00356 
00357       tournament_selection(selected_population,
00358                            current_population,
00359                            current_f,
00360                            n,
00361                            N,
00362                            params->tournament_size);
00363 
00364       // variation
00365 
00366       variation(sampled_population,selected_population,params,num_vals);
00367 
00368       // evaluation of new candidates
00369       
00370       evaluate_population(sampled_population,sampled_f,n,N,stats->num_evals);
00371       
00372       // replacement
00373       
00374       replacement(current_population,
00375                   sampled_population,
00376                   n,
00377                   N,
00378                   current_f,
00379                   sampled_f);
00380 
00381       // statistics
00382 
00383       compute_population_statistics(current_population,current_f,n,N,num_vals,stats);
00384 
00385       // print current status
00386 
00387       if ((params->quiet_mode==0)&&(params->bisection==0))
00388         print_status(t,stats);
00389 
00390       // should terminate?
00391 
00392       if ((t>max_generations)||(stats->success==1))
00393         done=1;
00394     }
00395 
00396   // free memory
00397 
00398   delete[] num_vals;
00399   delete[] sampled_f;
00400   delete[] current_f;
00401 
00402   free_population(current_population,n,N);
00403   free_population(selected_population,n,N);
00404   free_population(sampled_population,n,N);
00405 
00406   // return with success/failure (0/1)
00407 
00408   return stats->success;
00409 }

00411 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00412 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00413 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00415 
00416 int variation(int **sampled_population,int **selected_population, Parameters *params, int *num_vals)
00417 {
00418   int N=params->population_size;
00419   int n=params->problem_size;
00420   int loud=params->verbose_mode;
00421 
00422   if (loud)
00423     separator(stdout,0);
00424 
00425   TreeModel *t = new TreeModel(n, num_vals);
00426  
00427   // learn the model structure and model parameters
00428 
00429   t->learnStructure(selected_population,N,loud);
00430   t->learnProbabilities(selected_population,N,loud);
00431 
00432   // sample the learned model to generate new candidate solutions
00433 
00434   t->sampleModel(sampled_population,N);
00435 
00436   // free memory
00437 
00438   delete t;
00439 
00440   // return the number of generated individuals
00441 
00442   return N;
00443 }

00451 void print_status(int t, PopulationStatistics *stats)
00452 {
00453   printf("Generation: %u\n",t);
00454   printf("   min:  %f\n",stats->minF);
00455   printf("   max:  %f\n",stats->maxF);
00456   printf("   mean: %f\n",stats->avgF);
00457   separator(stdout);
00458 }

00464 
00465 void separator(FILE *f, int type)
00466 {
00467   if (type==0)
00468     fprintf(f,"- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -\n");
00469   else
00470     fprintf(f,"---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00471 }

00473 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------

00475 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00477 
00478 void print_summary(PopulationStatistics *stats)
00479 {
00480   printf("Summary:\n");
00481   printf("   status       = %s\n",(stats->success)? "success":"failure");
00482   printf("   best_found   = %f\n",stats->maxF);
00483   printf("   num_evals    = %lu\n",stats->num_evals);
00484   printf("   pop_size     = %u\n",stats->population_size);
00485   printf("   problem_size = %u\n",stats->problem_size);
00486 }
